item.title: A Large-scale and Longitudinal Measurement Study of DKIM Deployment
item.description:
Overview

In this paper, we provide a large-scale and longitudinal measurement study on how well DKIM is deployed and managed. Our measurement results show that 28.1% of Alexa Top 1 million domains have enabled DKIM, of which 2.9% are misconfigured. We demonstrate that the issues of DKIM key management and DKIM signatures are prevalent in the real world, even for well-known email providers (e.g., Gmail and Mail.ru).

item.title: Weak Links in Authentication Chains: A Large-scale Analysis of Email Sender Spoofing Attacks
item.description:
Overview

This paper systematically analyzes the transmission of an email and identiﬁes a series of new attacks capable of bypassing SPF, DKIM, DMARC and user-interface protections. We conduct a largescale experiment on 30 popular email services and 23 email clients, and ﬁnd that all of them are vulnerable to certain types of new attacks.
